website_summaries.verdict: For novice Android users with a desire to greatly personalize their experience, the Sony Xperia Z4 is a beautifully constructed tablet with high-end specs that won't disappoint.
pros: The Sony Xperia Z4's slim, waterproof design is simultaneously sleek and solid
Running the latest version of Android, it features a colorful user-friendly overlay
It has a sharp HD screen, and its performance is fast and smooth
cons: The optional Bluetooth keyboard is cramped to type on and has a frail plastic build

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Device
customer_reviews.text: My Euro acquaintances swear by Sony phones and tablets, so I was happy to be able to try one out here in the States. And at a great prices running Android. So far, it has been awesome. It's going to go on a little trip across the pond soon in which it is going to be used as a phone and a mobile broadband device. I expect it will be fine - I'll post any unexpected results that we encounter. Finally, we'll see how well it holds up over a longer period, six months or a year. I'll post these results as well if they prove different than expected.
customer_reviews.author: dane

customer_reviews.title: I love the fact that I can make call and text ...
customer_reviews.text: I been using this tablet for about a week now. So far I'm loving it. I love the fact that I can make call and text message like a regular phone on the Xperia Z4 tablet. Pro: Waterproof Great battery Extra light weigh Unlock Already pre install phone icon and message icon Front facing Speaker 95% pure android 98% no lag at all (no joke) Cons: Locations of the power button Speaker not loud enough Only lag was on the picture widget It's still worth the price. It's a shame if this tablet come to the USA, the carrier and Sony will take a lot of the features from this tablet off. Specially VZW.

customer_reviews.title: Crack in screen, now it's gone.
customer_reviews.text: The Xperia Z4 tablet was an interesting android tablet...for the time it lasted. One day a crack appeared across the screen. And unlike other touch devices where this happens, the touchscreen no longer works. It's basically a brick now without insurance. I have an iPad2 that is maybe 7 years old and it's in perfect, very durable. This lasted for a few months. As cool as the screen and thin body was, I got it for the remote ps4 feature. This is buggy and laggy. Games are playable, but it's hardly worth it, imo. Overall, don't take the risk like I did. No insurance means this could happen to you. Apparently these tablets are quite delicate.
